availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Rorer (Hopkins County postmaster and examiner)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and public servant. Virginia native. Married to Josephine Rorer. Postmaster in Hopkins County in 1842 and 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Examiner for Hopkins County in 1865. Member of the Masonic Order at Madisonville Lodge, No. 143.

ab.bibl:
"Majority and Minority Reports in the Contested Election Case of Morton against Gregory, made to the House or Representatives, December 18, 1865," in Legislative Document, No. 13, (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 47.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, accessed on ancestry.com (Washington, D.C.: National Archives) (accessed on March 22, 2017). Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at the Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 128.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1.
Find A Grave, "Samuel Rorer (unknown-July 6, 1880)," Memorial #120366184, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/120366184 (accessed August 30, 2018).
